stem: The nurse is coordinating the multidisciplinary discharge plan for a client following a stroke. Based on the client's documented functional deficits in the EHR, match the client's need to the most appropriate healthcare professional.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
08:00: Client (68y/o female) status-post left-sided ischemic stroke. Weakness noted in the right side of the body. 
08:30: Client appears frustrated during morning care. She states she wants to go home but is worried about who will help her with finances and groceries. 
09:00: During breakfast, the client was observed to have 'pocketing' of food in her right cheek and a gurgling voice after drinking coffee.

tabs.title: Functional Assessment
tabs.content:
CategoryFindingGoal
MobilityUnsteady gait; requires hemi-walkerSafe ambulation
Self-CareDifficulty with buttons and tooth brushingIndependent ADLs
CommunicationExpressive aphasia; slow to find wordsEffective speech
SwallowingFrequent coughing with thin liquidsSafe oral intake

tabs.title: Social Services Note
tabs.content: Patient lives alone in a two-story home. No immediate family in the area. Client is uninsured and expresses deep concern regarding the cost of post-stroke medications.

rows.text: Unsteady gait and need for a hemi-walker
Difficulty with buttons, grooming, and fine motor tasks
Pocketing of food and coughing with thin liquids
Aphasia and slow word-finding during conversation
Lack of insurance and concern for medication costs

rationale.correct: PT focuses on gross motor skills like gait and walking (r1). OT focuses on fine motor skills and Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) like dressing and grooming (r2). SLP manages both speech/communication and swallowing/dysphagia (r3, r4). Social Work manages financial resources, insurance, and discharge placement (r5).
clinicalPearls: Speech Pathologists (SLP) handle 'Everything above the neck'â€”speaking and swallowing.
OT is for 'Occupational' tasks: everything you do to take care of yourself (brushing teeth, dressing).
PT is for 'Physical' movement: moving your body from point A to point B.

questionTrap.trap: Referring a patient with social/financial issues to the physician instead of the Social Worker.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Always pick the most specific discipline for the problem. SW is the expert in resources and discharge planning.

mnemonic.title: PT vs OT
mnemonic.expansion: PT helps you get to the bathroom. OT helps you do your business once you're there.
